Key Match Events: The Yankees won the first game 3-2 with eight rookies starting for them.
Alex Verdugo grounded into a game-ending double play in the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was a makeup from Monday's rainout and many fans had to work or school.
The Yankees and Red Sox were combined 38 games out of first place when the day started.
Post-Match Reflections: The Red Sox lost both games and are tied with the Yankees at the bottom of the division at 73-72.
The best rivalry in baseball is not currently living up to expectations.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played in front of a very small crowd due to the makeup date and weather.
The Sox had 30,029 announced attendance, which was based on tickets sold.
